meanings.definition: The state or period of being a minor.
meanings.sent1: During my nonage, I couldn't wait to grow up and make my own decisions.
meanings.sent2: In the eyes of the law, a person in their nonage is not considered fully responsible.
meanings.sent3: The nonage of the puppy was evident in its playful and energetic behavior.
meanings.sent4: The nonage of the sapling was apparent in its delicate and slender trunk.
meanings.sent5: The nonage of the fledgling artist was reflected in the simplicity of their early works.

meanings.sent1: His nonage was evident in his impulsive decisions and lack of experience.
meanings.sent2: The nonage of the team was clear in their naive approach to the project.
meanings.sent3: Despite his nonage, he showed great potential and enthusiasm for learning.
meanings.sent4: The nonage of the flower was highlighted by its vibrant colors and delicate petals.
meanings.sent5: The nonage of the comedian shone through in his playful and lighthearted jokes.
